goal.core.agent

Interface EnvironmentCapabilities

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEnvironmentCapabilities, NoEnvironmentCapabilities

    public interface EnvironmentCapabilities
    Provides and abstract representation of the capabilities of the agent in the environment. An agent needs to be able to retrieve percepts and rewards from an environment and an agent needs to be able to execute actions in the environment. Implementing classes can provide this functionality as they see fit.
    Author:
    mpkorstanje

      • getReward

        java.lang.Double getReward()
                           throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,
                                  eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
        Get the reward that the environment provides to this agent.
        Returns:
        Double containing number between 0 and 1 (usually), or null if the environment did not provide a reward.
        Throws:
        nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException
        eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException

      • getPercepts

        java.util.Set<eis.iilang.Percept> getPercepts()
                                              throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,
                                                     eis.exceptions.EnvironmentInterfaceException
        Collects percepts from the environment. When no percepts could be collected this method should return an empty set.
        Returns:
        the set of percepts received from the environment
        Throws:
        nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException
